New Records: Florian Wirtz scored Germany's fastest international goal after seven seconds, breaking Lukas Podolski's previous record from 2013
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé forced a fine save from Marc-André ter Stegen in the 26th minute
Germany doubled their lead early in the second half with a cross from Florian Wirtz to Jamal Musiala, who set up Kai Havertz for the goal
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann emphasized the importance of a strong start ahead of Euro 2024
The match was Germany's first win in their last four games
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and the confidence boost from the win
France coach Didier Deschamps criticized the team's performance and acknowledged Germany's better execution
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Groupama Stadium in Lyon, France with 56,000 attendees
Germany's win provided a confidence boost ahead of their next match against the Netherlands
